course.subject: SCIE
course.name: Teaching Science Using Innovative Teaching Tools
course.description: This course presents a unique opportunity for students to experience the process of preparing learning activities in contrast to being taught. The experiential program will provide a preview to potential students who wish to pursue a teaching career. Students will develop teaching tools for secondary school students under the guidance of instructors. They will participate in organizing a science camp in which they will deliver their teaching tools through innovative learning activities such as analyzing movie clips using the knowledge of science. The experiential course also serves to strengthen students' concepts in science, and improves their organization and presentation skills which are important in future success. Instructor's consent is required for enrollment.
course.prerequisites: Level 4 or above in HKDSE (1x Physics OR 1x Chemistry OR Mathematics M1/M2 )

reviews.author: 二十一世紀精分男
reviews.title: Recommended even for those who want to teach in universities
reviews.comment_content:
There are 3 teaching activities in the course, delivered to the local secondary school students.

In general SCIE3110 is like of the structure:
first of all discuss your teaching proposal with your instructor
→submit proposal
→teaching activity1(Mini lecture) AND teaching activity2(An experiment in your discipline: ocean science/phy/math this year)
→activity 3(A easy project for them, you are guiding them to do)
→teaching portfolio and documentation (put your ppt and videos in one ZIP file.)

Just like a practice, I think it just requires you to improve every time, that's it.
reviews.comment_teaching: I'm of Physics major, so the instructor is Dr. Ng.  He gave detailed and patient suggestions on everything.  Including but not limited to any PPT, the design experiment and the project, also the presentation skills XD.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got about the LOWEST mark on activity 1 and 2 in the whole class on both of the students' and instructor's scoring assessments, especially in activity 2 i got 16.5/50 given by the instructor and 83.73 by students (mean = 92)
For activity 3, i got 99.07/100 from students and 43/50 from instructor.

Final grade => A-!!!
reviews.comment_workload:
Light for activities 1 and 2, you just need to do some PPT and do some practice before the presentations, and prepare for the experiment, which could be very easy.

while for the group work part is was not.  We originally want to do the hydro generator, but unfortunately it didn't work at all, even under a very strong push.  Thus, we gave up on that like a week before the activity.  We were rushing for everything that time and finally having the thing done at night of one day before...
But thankfully all things were done and the project was conducted successfully.
